page.title: 10Education in Four Elms
page.content: The present school in Four Elms was built and opened in 1895 to replace the old school run in a chapel. 54 children now attend the school with the age range of 5-9 years. During the war an air raid shelter was built which is now a store room. In 1963 the school kitchen was converted into a staff room nd toilets.Two years later a pool as built with attached changing rooms. The following year two more classrooms were added to the school & in 1979 a brand new toilet block was built. The pupil/teacher ratio at the school is about 1-19. The school uses both the local church & village halls for school activities.The school has been running for 90 years and will go on for another 90, even if it is threatened with closure. The villagers see the school as an asset to the village and it would be missed considerably....
